intro: Marah major, commonly known as the African bitter melon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and pumpkins. The plant produces yellow flowers and edible fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are hairy and trailing. The fruit has a bitter taste and is sometimes used to treat ailments like diabetes and hypertension.
